title: John Weaver (political consultant)
deleted: In a January 2021 article published in [[The American Conservative]], Weaver was accused of sexual misconduct by several men, which included harassment and abuse of power allegations.<ref>{{Cite news|title=The Lincoln Project’s Predator|work=The American Conservative|url= https://www.theamericanconservative.com/articles/the-lincoln-projects-predator/}}</ref>

title: John Weaver (political consultant)
added: Weaver is married and has two children.<ref name="Weaver acknowledges inappropriate messages"/>

title: John Weaver (political consultant)
added: Weaver is married and has two children.<ref name="Weaver acknowledges inappropriate messages"/> He is a [[cancer survivor]], having been diagnosed with [[leukemia]] in 2002.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Zengerle |first1=Jason |title=Winning Isn’t Everything |url=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2015/10/john-weaver-consultant-213273 |access-date=January 31, 2021 |work=[[Politico]] |date=December 2015}}</ref>

title: John Weaver (political consultant)
deleted: In the 1980s, Karl Rove had accused Weaver of making sexual advances on a young man; this accusation was dismissed as a "lie."<ref>{{cite web | last1=Green | first1=Joshua | title=Karl Rove in a Corner | url=https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2004/11/karl-rove-in-a-corner/303537/ | date=November 2004 | work=[[The Atlantic]] | access-date=February 1, 2021 | quote=The details vary slightly according to which insider tells the story, but the main point is always the same: after Weaver went into business for himself and lured away one of Rove's top employees, Rove spread a rumor that Weaver had made a pass at a young man at a state Republican function. Weaver won't reply to the smear, but those close to him told me of their outrage at the nearly two-decades-old lie.}}</ref>
